attributes.action: 1.Stop all Immigration raids on Bangladeshi restaurants and takeawys, 2. Regularize undocumented Bengali speaking migrant curry workers, 3.Relax the immigration rules that restrict unskilled workers from entering the country so that Bangladeshi chefs can enter UK and keep our curry houses and restaurants running, 4.Recognize knowledge of kitchen language (i.e Bengali/ Sylheti) as an essential skill
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There are approximately 12,000 Bangladeshi restaurants and takeaways across the UK, generating a £3.5 billion per annum to the economy of United Kingdom. At present there is an acute shortage of skilled Front Staff, Chefs, Cooks, Kitchen Porters etc. 
The new ‘points based system’ does not take into account the needs of the Bangladeshi catering trade ,  essential kitchen and community language skills have been ingnored. Since January this year immigration authority have stepped up their raids on Bangladeshi restaurants. Heavy-handed approaches by BIA in these raids are spreading  fear and terror in our community. If nothing is done soon the collapse of many Bangladeshi businesses will only add to an already adverse economic situation in this country.

rejection.details: Please make your title one simple call for action, with extra detail included further down.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
